thread.title: Chuck E. Cheese's has always served beer and wine, by the way, but now they want to be hipper
thread.title_full: Chuck E. Cheese's has always served beer and wine, by the way, but now they want to be hipper - San Antonio Express-News

author: Craig Hlavaty, Houston Chronicle
title: Chuck E. Cheese's has always served beer and wine, by the way, but now they want to be hipper
text:
Photo: CEC Entertainment Inc Image 1 of / 16 16 Chuck E. Cheese is slimming down and now brandishing a guitar.
Photo: CEC Entertainment Inc Chuck E. Cheese is slimming down and now brandishing a guitar. Image 2 of 16 The average weekend in the life of a San Antonian 25 to 30 years ago
Photo: San Antonio Express-News The average weekend in the life of a San Antonian 25 to 30 years ago Image 3 of 16 When the alarm clock rings, you wake up rocking to Saxon and Rush hits, played by DJ Joe "The Godfather" Anthony.
Photo: Courtesy Al Rendon When the alarm clock rings, you wake up rocking to Saxon and Rush... Image 4 of 16 You might stop at the original Earl Abel's on Broadway and Hildebrand for a hearty breakfast to get you through your jam-packed day.
Photo: COURTESY PHOTO You might stop at the original Earl Abel's on Broadway and... Image 5 of 16 Nice and full, with your money burning a hole in your pocket, your wardrobe could use some Jordache and Gloria Vanderbilt additions, maybe even a new pair of Kaepas. So, you make your way to either Windsor Park, Central Park of Crossroads Mall to spend your paycheck. You might even try Mervyn's, Winns or Solo Serve if you have time.
Photo: ROBERT MCLEROY, SAN ANTONIO EXPRESS-NEWS Nice and full, with your money burning a hole in your pocket, your... Image 6 of 16 While you're there, you run into a group of friends. They said they tried inviting you to the Blessed Sacrament dance last night but you weren't home when they called. They invite you to go cruising down Military Drive tomorrow night.
While you're there, you run into a group of friends. They said they... Image 7 of 16 But, you were already planning to hit up the original Taco Land, Sneakers or the Showcase to jam out.
Photo: 2007 Getty Images But, you were already planning to hit up the original Taco Land,... Image 8 of 16 You might have started your weekend off with some miniature golf at Cool Crest over on the near West Side. Or maybe even The Castle fun center across town on the North Side.
Photo: Billy Calzada, For The Express-News You might have started your weekend off with some miniature golf at... Image 9 of 16 But, you would for sure meet up with group at Diversions or Rocky J's if you change your mind.
But, you would for sure meet up with group at Diversions or Rocky... Image 10 of 16 The shopping and socializing worked off your waffles and eggs from breakfast. You haven't made a trip to Handy Andy or Kroger so dinner at home is out of the cards but it's nothing a stop at G.W. Jr's, Murf's Better Burger, or Whopper Burger (now Burger Boy) for a quick bite can't fix. Better yet, the weekend was made for pizza. Why not stop by Mr. Gatti's Pizza, Pizza Inn or Fargo's Pizza.
Photo: 2003 Getty Images The shopping and socializing worked off your waffles and eggs from... Image 11 of 16 On the way home, you spot a few emergency vehicles around Centeno's market. Ten minutes until 5, you rush home to get the scoop on what happened from none other than Chris Marrou. Plus, it's been a while since you heard anything about the Iguanas, Riders, Gunslingers, but Dan Cook will fill you in.
Photo: JOHN DAVENPORT, SAN ANTONIO EXPRESS-NEWS On the way home, you spot a few emergency vehicles around Centeno's... Image 12 of 16 Afterwards, you flip channels between MTV and the A-Team while weighing your options for things to do tonight.
Photo: NBC Universal, Inc. Afterwards, you flip channels between MTV and the A-Team while... Image 13 of 16 Until your crush calls and suggests a date to the Mission Drive-In Theatre. Back to the Future came out last week and you've been dying to see it so put on the threads you bought earlier and head out.
Photo: Matt Hinton Until your crush calls and suggests a date to the Mission Drive-In... Image 14 of 16 And you ended your night with a visit to one of the few Taco Cabanas. Back when it was puro S.A., and had not yet expanded outside the city.
Photo: Courtesy Photo / Taco Cabana And you ended your night with a visit to one of the few Taco... Image 15 of 16 And in the morning you’d get both the San Antonio Light and San Antonio Express-News to check the sports section to see how the new look Spurs - David Robinson, Sean Elliott, Terry Cummings, Willie Anderson and Rod Strickland – who were set to take San Antonio to the Promise land – had done the night before against Jordan and the Bulls.
Photo: James Blaylock, Light File Photo And in the morning you’d get both the San Antonio Light and San... Image 16 of 16 Chuck E. Cheese's has always served beer and wine, by the way, but now they want to be hipper 1 / 16 Back to Gallery According to harried headlines it would appear that the Irving-based Chuck E. Cheese’s is just now serving beer and wine but according to company reps, they’ve always served alcohol.
Headlines this week suggested that customers could now order a cup of Bud Light or a glass of merlot but as company spokesperson Alexis Linn notes that’s always been the case.
“From the beginning we’ve served alcohol but there is a two-drink limit for drinkers,” Linn says.
That policy is in effect at the company’s 500-plus corporate-owned store. There are 30 or so franchisee-owned stores who have the option of serving alcohol if they would prefer. Alcohol service has varied over the years by region.
What is really happening is that the kid’s birthday party headquarters is actually testing out different options at it locations to cater to millennial parents and those that fancy themselves foodies.
RELATED: Best things about being a kid in Houston during the '90s
Millennials are starting to have kids and according to market research they want their dining options, even when throwing a three-year-old’s “Frozen”-themed birthday, to be on par with what they have the rest of the time.
That means a revamped pizza menu , craft beer options, specialty coffee, churros, and free Wi-Fi. A slimmer Chuck E. Cheese now sports skinny jeans, looking more like he's about to open for the Black Keys.
One craft beer option and a seasonal craft beer option are the norm.
RELATED: Innocent things from our childhoods that could be seen as offensive and even banned today
"We’re testing craft beers in as many markets as we can," Linn says.
The free Internet would conceivably be for parents who need to answer an urgent work email or for bored siblings to escape into an iPad.
Linn says that their new pizza offerings beat out Pizza Hut in a blind taste test after bringing a professional chef into the fold.
What the company wants to do now is cater to adults and parents as much as kids, Linn says. The company’s target age range for kids is one year to nine years old.
